alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alaska Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 9:05AM AKST until February 22 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow, blowing snow and drifting snow occurring. Plan on very difficult travel conditions. Visibility will be near zero at times. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, are expected. Storm totals snowfall since Monday will be 14 inches south of Donnelly Dome, with 2 to 4 inches north of Donnelly Dome. South winds gusting to 45 mph are occuring north of Black Rapids causing low visibility in blowing snow. * WHERE...Along the Richardson Highway. * WHEN...Until 3 PM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will continue through this afternoon, then taper off in the late afternoon. North of the Black Rapids south winds gusting 45 mph are causing blowing snow and low visibiltiy, but those winds and blowing snow will taper off this afternoon. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow and blowing snow means severe winter weather conditions are occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
